event_breakdown:
* On June 29, 2023, three individuals, including one Jewish person, were attacked by a group of people in Asheville, North Carolina, during a Palestinian Resistance event.
* On June 30, a rally and memorial was held in order to condemn an attack on three people, including Jewish people. This attack took place on the same day but did not take place in Asheville, North Carolina.
* On July 1, 2023, a rally was held against the attack that had occurred on June 29. It took place in New York City outside the offices of the Anti-Defamation League and the Jewish Agency.
* On July 2, the Anti-Defamation League (ADL) released a statement in which they condemned the attack on the three individuals in Asheville. The ADL called for an end to all forms of antisemitism, racism, and bigotry.
* On July 6, the ADL again released a statement in which they condemned the attack in Asheville. The ADL also reached out to the victims of the attack and offered its support.
* On July 7, a candlelight vigil was held for the victims in Asheville. It took place in Battery Park in New York City.
* On July 8, a protest against antisemitism took place in Washington D.C. Protesters gathered in front of the White House and Capitol.
